properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 9:21PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Des Moines IA
properties.description:
...Hazardous Travel In Some Areas This Evening with Bitter Cold
Air Surging into the State...

.A strong Arctic cold front continues to push southeast through
the state tonight. Strong northwest winds and light snow behind
the front have led to areas of blowing snow. Rapidly falling
temperatures also accompany the front, which may lead to a flash
freeze of wet or slushy roads over south central into
southeastern Iowa this evening.

Bitter cold temperatures and breezy winds will combine to drop
wind chill values to dangerously cold levels late tonight into
Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow.
Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting
as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind
chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Iowa.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST
tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will plummet and it is
possible that wet or slushy roads could flash freeze, creating
icy spots on roadways this evening.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY
